The ABS light is on. What do you do ?

A. You have to stop immediately, because you have no brakes anymore.
B. You drive on, but you have it checked at the garage.
C. You pull the fuse, so that the light stops burning.
e: An ABS light on your car's dashboard means there is an issue with the car's anti-lock braking system. The Anti-lock Braking System &#40;ABS&#41; is a safety system that prevents the wheels of a vehicle from locking up when braking, and this warning tells you that the system is not working as intended. The ABS light is usually an amber, yellow, or orange light that spells out “ABS” and turns on during startup for a few seconds. If the ABS light stays on, then you might be dealing with a faulty ABS control module, low brake fluid levels, and a faulty wheel speed sensor.

The maximum speed is limited to 30 km/h.

q:
How long is a Belgian driving licence in bank card format valid ?

A. 1 year.
B. 5 years.
C. 10 years.
e:
LESSON 1
A Belgian driving licence in bank card format is valid for 10 years. After 10 years, you must renew it at your local municipality, without having to retake the exam.

q:
Is there a medicine to reduce the alcohol concentration in the blood ?

A. Yes, a doctor can prescribe one.
B. Yes, it is available in a pharmacy.
C. No, such a medicine does not exist.
e: LESSON 28

q:
Where must the reflective safety vest be located ?

A. Inside the interior of the car.
B. In the trunk of the car.
e: Motorway - The reflective safety vest, also known as the yellow vest, must be located inside the vehicle's interior, within easy reach, and not in the trunk. It is recommended to store it in the glove compartment, under the driver's seat, or in a door pocket so that it is immediately accessible to the driver if they need to exit the vehicle on a motorway or a road for motor vehicles.

q:
The car in front of you wants to turn left.
There is no cyclist on the cycle path next to you.
Are you allowed to drive on the cycle path to pass the car on the right ?
e:
LESSON 3 Cyclists - The cycle path is not part of the roadway.
You are not allowed to drive your car on it.

q:
Which road sign indicates a narrowing of the roadway to the right ?

A. Sign 1.
B. Sign 2.
e:
LESSON 2 Traffic Lanes - Sign 1: Danger sign.
Sign 2: Sign indicating a narrowing having the importance of a traffic lane.

q:
The police ask for your driving licence during a check.

A. You must always carry the original driving licence with you.
B. You have 24 hours to present the original driving licence.
e:
LESSON 9
If you are driving, you must have your original driver's license with you.

q:
What should you do if you notice an oil leak under your car ?

A. Continue driving until the next service.
B. Go to a garage as soon as possible.
C. Check the oil level before every trip and add oil if needed.
e:
LESSON 31
An oil leak can cause serious engine damage. Even if you top up the oil regularly, the leak remains dangerous. You must have the leak repaired in a garage as soon as possible.

q:
The four digits following the word DOT on the sidewall of a tire indicate the tire's production date.

A. The first two digits show the week, and the last two the year.
B. The first two digits show the year, and the last two the week.
C. The four digits have nothing to do with the production date.
e:
LESSON 31
The DOT code includes a 4-digit number: the first two digits indicate the week of manufacture, and the last two indicate the year. For example, 3519 means the tire was made in week 35 of 2019.

q:
A shepherd walking on the road with his sheep is...

A. A pedestrian.
B. A driver.
e: In the road code, he is considered a driver.

q:
There is heavy traffic on the motorway entrance ramp.
When are you allowed to merge ?

A. You may merge as soon as it is safe to do so.
B. You must follow the cars in front of you to the end of the ramp before merging.
e:
LESSON 4
The zipper principle does not apply when entering a motorway.
So you do not have to drive to the end of the ramp before merging.
You may merge wherever it is safe to do so.

q:
You drive past this sign.
Are you allowed to overtake a motorcycle on the left here ?
e:
LESSON 22
The sign is placed 150 meters before the level crossing. You are driving on a regular roadway here.

q:
To whom must I show my ID card in the event of an accident ?

A. To all persons involved in the accident if they ask, and to the qualified officer.
B. Only to the qualified officer.
e:
LESSON 29
In the event of an accident involving only material damage and if you are over 15 years old, you must present your identity card to the other people involved if they request it. In the case of injuries or serious damage, the authorities may also require it.

q:
I answer a call with my phone mounted on a support.

A. There is no risk.
B. I must stay extra alert and vigilant.
e:
LESSON 29
The support does not eliminate potential distractions. You need to stay focused on the traffic.

q:
In which direction should a car's wheels be turned if the driver wants to turn left, but the intersection is not yet clear ?

A. To the left.
B. Straight ahead.
e: LESSON 21

q:
When is it allowed to drive on the peak-hour lane if there is no green arrow above it ?

A. You may not drive on it.
B. It is allowed to exit or enter the road.
e: LESSON 4

q:
Must you use the left indicator when you're already properly positioned to turn left ?

A. Yes, always, and turn it off as soon as the manoeuvre is completed.
B. No, because you're already well positioned.
e:
LESSON 21
A turn signal is there to indicate your intentions, even if you are already in the right position.

q:
An intersection without traffic lights or priority signs.
Is the blue car allowed to overtake a two-wheeled moped on the left ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 16
This is an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies.
At this type of intersection, the car is only allowed to overtake a cyclist on the left.

q:
You are on a motorway entrance ramp, but you forgot to start your GPS.
Can you stop behind the white line ?

A. I can stop behind the white line because I am not yet on the motorway.
B. I cannot stop behind the white line because I am already on the motorway.
e:
LESSON 4
The entrance ramp is part of the motorway. Stopping or parking on the ramp is prohibited.

q:
The moon-white light is on at this level crossing with double tracks.
Which vehicles are you allowed to overtake on the left if it's safe ?

A. Only cyclists and similar road users.
B. Only cyclists and two-wheeled mopeds.
C. All vehicles.
e:
LESSON 16
As long as the red lights are not flashing, you may approach the level crossing.
When the red lights flash alternately, you must stop and you are not allowed to enter the level crossing.

q:
What does this traffic sign mean ?

A. You are approaching a tram stop.
B. Tram tracks are located on the roadway.
e:
LESSON 1
This is a warning sign.
Watch out for trams, which always have priority.

q:
Fill in a number.
After which traffic sign are you driving on a priority road ?
e:
LESSON 19
Sign 2 means you are on a priority road. You have priority at all intersections until the sign is cancelled or another sign changes the priority.
Sign 1 gives you priority only at the next intersection.
Sign 3 says nothing about priority; it only means traffic flows in one direction.
Sign 4 simply indicates a direction you must follow, not priority.

q:
Being stationary to pick up or drop off people is allowed...

A. ______ only at a bus stop.
B. ______ only at a bus stop and on a bus lane.
C. ______ at a bus stop, on a bus lane, and on a special reserved route.
e:
LESSON 22
You are only allowed to stop at a bus stop to let someone get in or out of the vehicle.

q:
You are not allowed to overtake that car at this intersection.
But who are you allowed to overtake ?

A. Only a cyclist.
B. Only a cyclist and a class A moped.
C. A cyclist, a class A moped, and a motorcycle.
e:
LESSON 16
At an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies, you may only overtake a cyclist and similar users, such as an electric scooter, on the left.

q:
Are you allowed to stop on a motorway at this sign to send an urgent message ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 4
On a motorway, you may only stop on an emergency bay if your vehicle breaks down or in case of a real emergency. Sending a message, even an urgent one, is not a valid reason. Stopping without a justified reason is dangerous and prohibited.

q:
Zipper merging is required. Where should you merge ?

A. As soon as possible.
B. As soon as it is safe.
C. Just before the lane ends.
e:
LESSON 2
Zipper merging is mandatory when a lane disappears and traffic is heavily slowed down or stopped (like in a traffic jam). You must merge just before the disappearing lane ends.
When entering a motorway, zipper merging is not used—instead, you must give priority to drivers already on the motorway.

q:
A yellow broken line at the edge of the carriageway.
This car may stop to let someone get out.
But is the driver also allowed to park there ?
e:
LESSON 26
When a yellow broken line is painted at the edge of the carriageway, you may only stop.
Parking on the carriageway is prohibited.

q: Outside a built-up area, must you give way to a bus leaving a bus stop ?
e:
LESSON 22
You must give way inside a built-up area. You must never give way to a coach leaving a bus stop.

q:
May you use the horn at night in case of imminent danger ?

A. Yes, you may.
B. No, at night you should rather flash your high beams.
e:
LESSON 11
Only in case of imminent danger, such as when a car suddenly changes lanes, you may use the horn at night.

q:
You are approaching this intersection. Where must you stop ?

A. Just before the stop line.
B. 1 metre before the stop line.
C. Just before the STOP sign.
e:
LESSON 19
You must always come to a complete stop when there is a STOP sign, even if there are no other road users. You stop just before the stop line. If there is no stop line, you stop level with the STOP sign. You must give way to other drivers on the road you intend to enter.

q:
In a van, there is a front seat where the driver and two passengers can sit. What is the minimum required width of that seat ?

A. 125 cm.
B. 130 cm.
C. 135 cm.
e:
LESSON 10
The width must be enough for:
Driver: 55 cm.
Each passenger: 40 cm.
Total: 55 + 40 + 40 = 135 cm.

q:
You damaged another car while parking. You don't know who the owner is.
How much time do you have to report it at a police station ?

A. 12 hours.
B. 24 hours.
C. As soon as possible.
e:
LESSON 29
If you damage someone's property and the police cannot come to the scene, you must report it as soon as possible at a police station or online via Police-on-Web (for minor damage). The sooner you report it, the more likely it is that the facts will be correctly recorded. Make sure you have all necessary information, such as the location and time of the incident, the license plate of the damaged vehicle, and photos of the damage.

q:
Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection ?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 16
At intersections where no traffic signs regulate priority, or where this road sign is present and therefore the priority to the right applies, it is forbidden to overtake on the left:
a vehicle with a trailer,
a vehicle with more than two wheels,
or a motor vehicle with two wheels.
A cyclist is not a motor vehicle, so you are allowed to overtake them. You may also overtake a personal mobility device.

q:
Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection ?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 16
At intersections where no traffic signs regulate priority, or where this road sign is present and therefore the priority to the right applies, it is forbidden to overtake on the left:
a vehicle with a trailer,
a vehicle with more than two wheels,
or a motor vehicle with two wheels.
A cyclist is not a motor vehicle, so you are allowed to overtake them. You may also overtake a personal mobility device.

q: Are these two vehicles crossing each other in the correct way ?
e:
LESSON 14
Vehicles must cross each other on the right. Only if arrows on the roadway indicate that they must cross on the left, is this of course allowed.

q: Are these two vehicles crossing each other in the correct way ?
e:
LESSON 14
Vehicles must cross each other on the right. Only if arrows on the roadway indicate that they must cross on the left, is this of course allowed.

B. No, he must use the pedestrian crossing.

LESSON 7

A pedestrian must use it if they are within 20 meters of the crossing.
That is not the case here.

q:

Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a green light ?
e:
LESSON 18
(1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.
(2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.
(3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.
(4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q:
Fill in a number.
Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a red light ?
e:
LESSON 18
(1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.
(2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.
(3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.
(4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q:
Fill in a number.
Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a steady amber light ?
e:
LESSON 18
(1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.
(2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.
(3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.
(4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q:
Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection ?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 16
At intersections where you have priority, you may overtake other drivers on the left.
- Priority at the next intersection.
- Priority road.
- Green traffic light.

q:
Beyond which traffic sign must you drive at least 70 km/h, if conditions allow ?

A. Beyond sign 1.
B. Beyond sign 2.
C. Beyond sign 1 and 2.
e:
LESSON 5
Only on a motorway (sign 1) does a minimum speed of 70 km/h apply, if conditions allow. On an express road (sign 2), this obligation does not exist.

q:
Beyond which traffic sign must you drive at least 70 km/h, if conditions allow ?

A. Beyond sign 1.
B. Beyond sign 2.
C. Beyond sign 1 and 2.
e:
LESSON 5
Only on a motorway (sign 1) does a minimum speed of 70 km/h apply, if conditions allow. On an express road (sign 2), this obligation does not exist.

q:
The police can ask any driver to take a breath test.
Is that also the case for a saliva test ?

A. Yes, a saliva test can be imposed on any driver.
B. Yes, if there is, based on objective findings, a suspicion of drug use.
e:
LESSON 28
In Belgium, there is zero tolerance for drugs in traffic. The police regularly carry out drug checks to determine whether you have certain prohibited substances in your body.
But a saliva test may only be carried out if the police suspect that you are under the influence of drugs, and this suspicion must be based on objective findings.

q:
The barrier of this level crossing is open and no bell is ringing.
However, the lights are out of order.
Are you allowed to overtake a moped on the left ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 16
At level crossings indicated by this sign, overtaking on the left is prohibited for: a horse-drawn vehicle; a vehicle with more than two wheels; or a two-wheeled motor vehicle, except when barriers are present or when the lunar white light is on.

q:
On this road marking that indicates a bus stop, you may drive.
But what else are you allowed to do ?

A. Wait.
B. Wait and park.
e:
LESSON 22
You are not allowed to park on the road marking that indicates a bus stop.
If there is no road marking but only a sign indicating the bus stop, you may not park within 15 meters before and after that sign.

q:
What is the maximum permitted speed within a built-up area in the Walloon Region when passing the sign indicating a pedestrian crossing ?

A. Maximum 20 km/h.
B. Maximum 30 km/h.
C. Maximum 50 km/h.
e:
SPECIAL PLACESThe sign indicating a pedestrian crossing does not set a speed limit.
Within built-up areas:
- Flanders and Wallonia: maximum 50 km/h.
- Brussels Region: maximum 30 km/h.

q:
Must a cyclist also give priority to pedestrians on a pedestrian crossing ?

A. Yes.
B. No, only drivers of motor vehicles.
e:
LESSON 7
All drivers must give priority to pedestrians on a pedestrian crossing. A cyclist is also considered a driver.

q:
One-way street.
Are speedpedelecs also allowed to ride in the opposite direction ?
e:
The vehicles mentioned on the traffic sign and allowed to ride in the opposite direction are:
- buses.
- class A mopeds.
- speedpedelecs.
- bicycles.

q:
A one-way street.
The additional sign indicates that cyclists and class A mopeds may ride in the opposite direction.
e: The additional sign indicates that only cyclists may ride in the opposite direction.

q: Does the sign that ends all local prohibitions also put an end to parking signs ?
e:
LESSON 26
The sign with a black diagonal stripe informs road users of the end of all regulations previously indicated by signs, except those concerning stopping and parking.

q:
The windshield washer reservoir is empty. This may negatively affect the driver's visibility.
What should you do ?

A. Stop immediately and refill.
B. Drive to the nearest garage.
C. Refill as soon as possible.
e:
LESSON 31
If you hear a humming or buzzing sound when you activate the washer but no liquid sprays onto the windshield, the reservoir is empty. You should refill it as soon as possible, because without washer fluid your visibility can be greatly reduced, especially in rain or when dirt splashes up from the road. Just like engine oil, the washer fluid level should be checked regularly.

q:
The photo is taken from the car you are driving.
You want to turn right at the intersection.
Are you allowed to drive here on the bus lane ?

A. No.
B. Yes, it is allowed.
C. Here, you must do it.
e:
LESSON 2
When approaching an intersection, you drive on the bus lane if you want to turn right.

q:
Inside a built-up area in the Walloon Region.
At what maximum speed are you allowed to pass this sign ?

A. Walking pace.
B. 30 km/h.
C. 50 km/h.
e:
LESSON 12
The sign is placed at a raised roadway feature.
You may cross it at a maximum speed of 30 km/h.

q:
The photo is taken from the car you are driving.
Who has the right of way ?

A. You.
B. The white truck.
e:
LESSON 20
There is no police officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the right-hand priority rule applies at the intersection.

q:
You are approaching this intersection. What does the traffic sign mean ?

A. An intersection.
B. An intersection where drivers coming from the right must yield.
C. You must yield to drivers coming from the right.
e:
LESSON 20
The traffic sign indicates that this is an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies.

q:
This prohibition sign applies to:

A. Only trucks.
B. Only trucks and coaches.
C. All types of vehicles.
e:
LESSON 10
Access prohibited to drivers of vehicles or vehicle combinations whose total length, including load, exceeds the length indicated.

q:
The train has already passed.
Are you allowed to drive on while the barriers are still rising ?
e:
LESSON 18
You may only cross the level crossing when the barriers are fully raised and the white moonlight signal is on.

q:
Fill in a number.
After which sign do you have priority ?
e:
LESSON 19
1. Priority to the right.
2. Road works.
3. Two-way traffic.
4. Priority at a road narrowing.

q:
You want to turn right at this intersection.
Do you have priority ?
e:
LESSON 19
The priority sign indicates that you have priority at this intersection. The blue supplementary sign indicates that the priority road bends to the right.

q:
What does the yellow sign mean ?

A. You must give way at the next intersection.
B. You have priority at the first upcoming intersection.
C. You are driving on a priority road.
e:
LESSON 19
The yellow priority sign means that you are driving on a priority road.
This means you have priority at the following intersections, until you see the sign “End of priority road”.

q:
You are not allowed to park on the roadway under a bridge, but you may park on the shoulder if there is one.
But are you allowed to stop on the roadway to let someone get out ?
e: WAITING AND PARKINGBoth parking and waiting on the roadway under a bridge are prohibited.

q: Does this white car have priority at the intersection ?
e:
LESSON 19
Before the intersection, there is a sign: End of priority road.

q:
You want to turn right at this intersection.
You slow down and, if necessary, you stop to give way to ______

A. All road users.
B. All drivers.
e:
LESSON 19
The priority sign indicates that you must give way to drivers on the crossing road.
If necessary, stop before the inverted triangles on the road surface, also called shark's teeth.

q:
This car has stopped because the traffic light is red.
But is it in the correct position ?
e:
LESSON 18
At some intersections, an advanced stop box for cyclists and two-wheeled mopeds is marked on the road. Cars must stop before the first stop line when the light is amber or red. Cyclists and two-wheeled mopeds stop before the second stop line, which is closest to the intersection.

q: Do you have to give way to drivers coming from the left here ?
e:
LESSON 19
You want to enter a roundabout. The give-way sign (inverted triangle) tells you to slow down and, if necessary, stop to give way. On a roundabout, drivers can only come from the left.
When entering a roundabout, you should not use the right indicator. You must, however, use it when leaving the roundabout.

q:
Which local prohibition does the top traffic sign put an end to ?

A. Only sign 1.
B. Only signs 1 and 2.
C. To all of these signs.
e:
LESSON 26
The sign with a black diagonal stripe indicates the end of all traffic regulations previously imposed by traffic signs, except those concerning stopping and parking.

q:
The indication sign indicates that this is a one-way street.
But what does the prohibition sign refer to ?

A. The Maximum Authorized Mass.
B. The Maximum Gross Weight.
e:
LESSON 9
No entry for drivers of vehicles whose M.G.W. exceeds the mass indicated on the sign.

q:
My vehicle has broken down. How long may my car remain on the public road ?

A. 3 hours.
B. 12 hours.
C. 24 hours.
e:
LESSON 27
A broken-down car may remain on the public road for a maximum of 24 hours.
An advertising vehicle may remain on the public road for a maximum of 3 hours.
It is forbidden to offer a vehicle for sale along the public road.

q:
The light is green: you may enter the intersection...

A. ... immediately.
B. ... only if the intersection is clear.
e:
LESSON 18
Even with a green light, you may not enter the intersection if traffic from the opposite direction could block you and you risk obstructing the intersection.

q:
A minor accident without injuries at an intersection.
What should you do ?

A. You notify the police.
B. You place a warning triangle and leave the cars where they are.
C. You park the cars in a safe place.
e:
LESSON 29
In case of a minor accident without injuries at an intersection, you should try to clear the intersection.
If the vehicles can still move, park them next to the roadway in a place where parking is permitted.

q:
Outside a built-up area in Wallonia.
What distance must be kept between two parked cars ?

A. 0.5 metres.
B. 1 metre.
C. 1.5 metres.
e:
WAITING AND PARKINGBoth inside and outside built-up areas, the required distance is 1 metre.
Make sure to respect this rule during the practical driving test.

q: Does this traffic sign also apply to buses and coaches ?
e:
This sign means: No entry for drivers of motor vehicles and trailers designed and built for the transport of goods.
An additional sign underneath may limit this prohibition to vehicles or combinations whose maximum authorised mass exceeds the indicated value.

q:
What are you allowed to do within 15 meters before and after the sign indicating a bus stop ?

A. No parking, but stopping is allowed.
B. No parking and no stopping.
C. Parking and stopping allowed.
e:
LESSON 26
Within 15 meters before and after a bus stop, parking is not allowed. However, you are allowed to stop briefly to let passengers get in or out.

q:
How should you react in case of a fire in a tunnel ?

A. You leave your vehicle while protecting it from theft.
B. You leave your vehicle and keep the key in the ignition.
C. You send a message to your loved ones telling them you love them.
e:
LESSON 29
You stop your vehicle as far to the right as possible, leave the key in the ignition, and exit the tunnel through the emergency exit.

q:
You are driving on a motorway and there is fog.
At what speed do you drive ?

A. Maximum 120 km/h.
B. Minimum 70 km/h.
C. At an adapted speed.
e:
LESSON 4
On motorways, the minimum speed is 70 km/h, but only if conditions allow it.
In case of fog, snow, traffic jams, heavy rain, etc., you must of course adapt your speed.

q: You have been drinking alcohol and you fear a police check. Is there any medicine that can quickly lower your blood alcohol level ?
e:
LESSON 28
There is no medicine or other remedy (such as drinking coffee) that can make your blood alcohol level drop faster. Only time allows your body to break down alcohol. On the contrary, some medicines even intensify the effects of alcohol.

q:
Alternating parking for certain vehicles.
When are you allowed to park your car after this sign ?

A. Never.
B. From 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.
C. From 6:00 p.m. to 7:30 a.m.
e:
LESSON 27
Alternating parking for certain vehicles
This traffic sign indicates that the parking space is reserved for alternating parking, for example for bicycles and cars.
In this example: from 6:00 p.m. to 7:30 a.m., cars are allowed to park.

q:
The Biological Clock
During which hours does the combination of fatigue, reduced cognitive performance, and physiological fluctuations make the body more vulnerable, potentially leading to an increase in accidents ?

A. Between 11:00 p.m. and 2:00 a.m.
B. Between 2:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m.
C. Between 5:00 a.m. and 8:00 a.m.
e:
Explanation:
Research shows that accident frequency rises during the night's low hours, especially between 2:00 and 5:00 a.m. This is because the body's circadian rhythm affects alertness, concentration, and reaction times. During this time window, fatigue and physiological weakness are at their peak, leading to slower responses and a higher likelihood of mistakes.

q:
You are approaching this intersection and you want to turn right.

A. You have priority over drivers coming from the left.
B. You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.
e:
LESSON 19
This is not a roundabout. There are no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the priority to the right applies.

q:
You are approaching a roundabout here.

A. True.
B. False.
e:
LESSON 19
This is not a roundabout but an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies.
A roundabout is indicated by the blue roundabout sign and usually has either a STOP sign or a “give way” sign. Here, there is no sign at all.

q:
You drank beer. Your friend is sober.
How will your reaction time compare to theirs ?

A. Longer.
B. Shorter.
C. Alcohol has no effect on reaction time.
e:
LESSON 13
Many factors can negatively affect a person's reaction time, such as fatigue, certain medicines, or distraction. Alcohol also slows down reaction time significantly.

q:
You stop behind a car that has stopped at a red traffic light.
When do you keep a safe distance ?

A. When you can still see the license plate.
B. When you can still see the rear tyres.
C. Distance does not matter.
e:
LESSON 18
LESSON 18
It is always safe to leave enough distance. Driving schools teach that it is safe if you can still see the rear tyres of the vehicle in front of you.

q:
You are driving a diesel car. At what engine speed is it best to change gears ?

A. 1000-1500.
B. 1500-2000.
C. 2000-2500.
e:
LESSON 30
LESSON 30
The correct rev range to shift gears with a diesel engine is 1500-2000 rpm.
Sequence of actions when shifting gears:
1. Fully press the clutch and simultaneously release the accelerator.
2. Shift into the correct gear.
3. Release the clutch until the biting point and gently press the accelerator.
4. Release the clutch completely and place your left foot beside the pedal.

q:
There is fog and the visibility is about 150 meters.
Which lights must be on ?

A. Only the dipped headlights.
B. Only the dipped headlights and the rear fog light.
C. The dipped headlights, the rear fog light and the front fog lights.
e:
LESSON 11
When visibility is less than 200 meters, dipped headlights must be on. The rear fog light is only mandatory when visibility is about 100 meters or less.

q:
There is fog and the visibility is about 90 meters.
Which lights must be on ?

A. Only the dipped headlights.
B. Only the dipped headlights and the rear fog light.
C. The dipped headlights, the rear fog light and the front fog lights.
e:
LESSON 11
When visibility is less than 200 meters, dipped headlights must be on. The rear fog light is only mandatory when visibility is about 100 meters or less.

q:
The bicycle is broken.
How much safe distance must you keep when overtaking this cyclist ?

A. 0.5 meters.
B. 1 meter.
C. 1.5 meters.
e:
LESSON 3
This cyclist is not riding. It is clearly outside the built-up area.
The safe passing distance is therefore 1.5 meters.
Inside a built-up area, it is 1 meter.

q:
Your car breaks down in a built-up area.
Normally, you place the warning triangle 30 meters behind your vehicle, so that it is visible from 50 meters by approaching traffic. But here this is not possible.
What do you do ?

A. You do not place a warning triangle.
B. You place the warning triangle on top of your car.
e:
LESSON 29
In a built-up area, you may place the warning triangle on top of the car.

q:
What should you do after starting the car engine ?

A. Drive off immediately.
B. Wait about 30 seconds.
C. Wait until the engine is fully warm.
e:
LESSON 30
To reduce environmental impact and engine wear, you should let the engine run for about 30 seconds after starting, so that the oil circulates properly. Then drive gently for the first few kilometers. Letting the engine idle for a long time wastes fuel and can harm lubrication. Drive moderately until the engine reaches its normal operating temperature.

q:
You drive past this traffic sign with your car.
Are you allowed to overtake a motorcycle with a sidecar on the left ?
e:
LESSON 16
The red prohibition sign indicates that drivers are not allowed to overtake an articulated vehicle or any vehicle with more than two wheels on the left. This no-overtaking rule applies until the next intersection, or it ends earlier if you see the END sign.
Therefore, a car driver may overtake a two-wheeled motorcycle on the left, but not a motorcycle with a sidecar.
Conversely, a motorcyclist may not overtake a car, since a car has more than two wheels.

q:
You are driving and several passengers are in the car.
Can you, as the driver, require them to wear their seat belts ?

A. No, you cannot.
B. Yes, you must do so.
e:
LESSON 10
Everyone in the car must wear a seat belt or sit in an appropriate child seat.

q:
What are you allowed to do on a raised traffic device ?

A. Not overtake any driver.
B. Overtake a cyclist.
C. Overtake a cyclist and a class A moped.
e:
LESSON 12
On a raised traffic device, it is forbidden to overtake to the left a horse-drawn vehicle, a two-wheeled motor vehicle, or a vehicle with more than two wheels. You may overtake a cyclist.

q: Beyond the sign, I may drive at a maximum speed of 20 km/h in the Walloon Region.
e:
SPECIAL PLACESThe sign indicates the beginning of a residential zone.
The maximum permitted speed there is 20 km/h.

q:
It is raining heavily. I switch on the rear fog lights______

A. As soon as visibility is less than 100 m.
B. As soon as visibility is less than 200 m.
C. Always.
e:
LESSON 11
The rear fog light must be switched on when visibility is less than 100 meters in fog or snowfall.
In heavy rain, it must always be switched on.

q:
The driver in front of you falls asleep. He suddenly drives onto the cycle path.
Are you allowed to use the horn in this imminent danger ?

A. Only during the day.
B. Only at night outside built-up areas.
C. Always in case of imminent danger.
e:
LESSON 11
When may you use the horn ?
During the day:
Inside and outside built-up areas: to warn others and prevent an accident.
Outside built-up areas: to warn a driver that you want to overtake.
Between sunset and sunrise:
Only in case of imminent danger.
In other cases, instead of using the horn, you must flash your headlights (alternate between high beam and low beam).

q:
You have hit a cyclist.
What do you do after placing the warning triangle and notifying the emergency services ?

A. You move him off the road.
B. You apply a pressure bandage on his bleeding arm.
C. You do nothing and wait for the emergency services.
e:
LESSON 29
An injured person should always be left in place. Do not give them food or drink. If they are bleeding, apply a pressure bandage to the wound.

q:
Can someone with epileptic seizures drive a car ?

A. Yes.
B. Never, because they can always have another seizure.
C. Only after a seizure-free period can a doctor grant permission to drive.
e:
Explanation:
A person with epileptic seizures is generally not allowed to drive.
After a first seizure, there is a driving ban of 6 months.
Someone with chronic epilepsy who, after treatment, has been seizure-free for 1 year may, with approval from a specialist doctor, be allowed to drive again.
After a new seizure, there is again a driving ban of 1 year.

q:
You are driving on a one-way road with three lanes and you want to turn left.
Where should you position yourself correctly ?

A. In the right lane.
B. In the middle lane.
C. In the left lane.
e:
LESSON 21
When you want to turn left, you must position yourself as far to the left as possible on the roadway.

q:
A cyclist wants to cross the road using the pedestrian crossing.
Does he have priority over the car coming from the left ?
e:
LESSON 7
If a cyclist wants to cross the road using a pedestrian crossing, he must get off the bicycle and cross on foot while holding the bike by hand.

q:
A road narrowing.
This traffic sign means you have priority over oncoming traffic.

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 14
The sign announces a road narrowing, but it does not indicate who has priority.
In this situation, there are no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the driver on the side of the narrowing must give way.

q:
This road marking warns you ______

A. ______ that you are approaching a dangerous intersection.
B. ______ that you are approaching an intersection where the right-hand priority rule applies.
e:
LESSON 20
At intersections where priority is not regulated by a police officer, traffic lights, or signs, the right-hand priority rule applies.
This road marking simply indicates that you are approaching an intersection where the right-hand priority rule is in force.

q:
Who has priority at this intersection ?

A. The cyclist.
B. The car.
e:
LESSON 20
This is an intersection where the priority to the right applies.
But the cyclist is riding on a continuous cycle path. The car coming from the right must first yield priority to the cyclist.

q: This blue sign means that in case of a road narrowing, drivers on this side of the road have priority over oncoming traffic.
e:
LESSON 14
The blue priority sign with arrows: priority.
The red priority sign with arrows: give way.

q:
May a firefighter regulate traffic and give orders at the place where the fire brigade is intervening ?

A. No, only the police can do that.
B. Yes, a firefighter can give orders.
C. Yes, they can give orders and also draw up a report.
e:
LESSON 17
All members of the fire services present at the scene of an intervention have the authority to regulate road traffic.
Firefighters may give binding orders to road users but are not allowed to draw up an official report or place traffic signs. If a road user refuses to comply with the firefighter's instructions, this must be reported afterwards to the police, who will issue the official report.

q:
What does this traffic sign mean ?

A. From here up to 250 meters further, no priority road.
B. End of the priority road in 250 meters.
C. Beginning of the priority road in 250 meters.
e:
LESSON 19
You are still driving on a priority road. The additional sign indicates that the priority road will end in 250 meters.

q:
Within a built-up area.
What distance must be kept between two parked cars ?

A. 0.5 metres.
B. 1 metre.
C. 1.5 metres.
e: WAITING AND PARKINGBoth inside and outside built-up areas, the required distance is 1 metre.

q:
It has snowed.
What must you do before driving your car ?

A. Clean the windshield and mirrors.
B. Clean the mirrors and all windows.
C. Remove the snow from the entire car.
e: In Belgium, when it snows, you must clear the entire car. Start with the windows (windshield, rear window, side windows) and mirrors to ensure good visibility, then remove the snow from the roof, the hood, and the rest of the bodywork. This is both a safety and a legal requirement, since snow falling from your car can endanger other road users.

q:
The oil warning light comes on. Can you keep driving like this ?

A. Yes, but not at high speed.
B. Yes, but better to go to a garage.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 31
If the oil warning light goes off as soon as the engine is running, that's fine. But if it stays on, something is wrong. Switch off the engine immediately and do not restart it, but check the oil level. If it's too low, top up with the oil recommended in your car's manual.

q:
This warning sign means that you are approaching a dangerous intersection.

A. True.
B. False.
e:
LESSON 19
This is not a warning sign but a priority sign.
It means that you have priority at the next intersection.

q:
In foggy conditions, when must the rear fog light be switched on ?

A. Always in case of fog.
B. When visibility is reduced to less than 100 meters.
C. When visibility is reduced to less than 200 meters.
e:
LESSON 11
In case of fog or snowfall, the rear fog light must be switched on when visibility is less than 100 meters.
In case of heavy rain, the rear fog light must always be switched on.
Front fog lights are not mandatory on a car, so they are never compulsory to use.

q:
Which drivers are you allowed to overtake on the left at this intersection ?

A. None, because the right-hand priority rule applies here.
B. Only cyclists.
C. Cyclists and two-wheeled mopeds.
e:
LESSON 20
At an intersection where you must give way to drivers coming from the right, you may only overtake a cyclist on the left.

q:
Who has priority at this intersection ?

A. The car.
B. The motorcycle.
e:
LESSON 19
In front of the motorcycle, shark teeth markings are painted on the road. Out of view, there is therefore a traffic sign indicating that it must give way.

q:
Who has priority at this intersection ?

A. The car.
B. The motorcycle.
e:
LESSON 19
It is an intersection where you must give way to drivers coming from the right.

q:
The white car is allowed, at that place ...

A. Only to stop.
B. To stop and to park.
C. Neither to stop nor to park.
e:
LESSON 26
This round traffic sign, with one diagonal stripe, indicates that on the side where the sign is placed, parking is prohibited on both the carriageway and the shoulder, up to the next intersection.

q:
Are you allowed to tow a broken-down vehicle in built-up areas ?

A. No, it is forbidden.
B. Yes, it is allowed at a maximum speed of 30 km/h.
e:
LESSON 12
It is forbidden on motorways and expressways.
Where towing is permitted, the maximum allowed speed is 30 km/h.

q:
Which road marking do you see in this picture ?

A. Chequered markings.
B. A hatched area.
C. A directional island.
e:
LESSON 22
You may drive over this road marking, but you are not allowed to stop or park on it.

q:
The owner of this car has already been inside the house for several minutes.
The car is:

A. Waiting.
B. Parked.
e:
WAITING AND PARKINGStopping/waiting is the time needed to let someone get in or out of the car, or to load/unload goods.
The car is therefore parked.

q:
You want to turn right.
Do you have to give way if a car is coming from the left ?

A. Yes, because it is a roundabout.
B. No, because you have priority from the right.
e:
LESSON 20
This is not a roundabout. There are also no signs regulating the priority.
So the priority from the right applies here.

q:
What lateral distance must legally be kept between two cars that cross each other ?

A. Sufficient.
B. At least 1 meter.
C. At least 1.5 meters.
e:
LESSON 14
The highway code states that when two cars cross each other, a sufficient lateral distance must be left.

q:
There is a traffic jam. When must an emergency corridor be formed ?

A. Only on motorways when emergency services are approaching.
B. Always on all roads with at least 2 lanes in the same direction.
e:
LESSON 4
In case of a traffic jam, drivers on a carriageway with two or more lanes in their direction must preventively form an emergency corridor for emergency services. This must be done before traffic comes to a complete stop.
On a two-lane road: between the left and right lane.
On a three-lane road: between the left and middle lane.
Drivers in the right lane may not move onto the hard shoulder, the bus lane, or any special lane reserved for buses.

q:
You are approaching an intersection with a dirt road. There are no signs regulating priority.
Do you have to give way to drivers coming from the dirt road ?

A. No, you have priority.
B. Yes, because the priority to the right applies here.
e:
LESSON 20
At an intersection with a dirt road, the priority to the right does not apply. Drivers coming from the dirt road must give way.

q:
At which intersection are you allowed to overtake a cyclist on the left ?

A. Only after sign 1.
B. Only after signs 1 and 2.
C. After all these signs.
e:
LESSON 19
Sign 1 = priority at the next intersection.
Sign 2 = priority road.
Sign 3 = priority from the right.

q:
At which intersection are you allowed to overtake a moped on the left ?

A. Only after sign 1.
B. Only after signs 1 and 2.
C. After all these signs.
e:
LESSON 19
Sign 1 = priority at the next intersection.
Sign 2 = priority road.
Sign 3 = priority from the right.
At intersections where you have priority, you may overtake a moped.

q:
At which intersection are you allowed to overtake this two-wheeled motorcycle on the left ?

A. Only after sign 1.
B. Only after signs 1 and 2.
C. After all these signs.
e:
LESSON 19
Sign 1 = priority at the next intersection.
Sign 2 = priority road.
Sign 3 = priority from the right.
At intersections where you have the right of way, you may overtake all vehicles on the left.

q:
It is nighttime. The car in front of you is driving slowly.
Are you allowed to use the horn to signal that you are going to overtake that car ?

A. Yes, but only outside built-up areas.
B. Yes.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 11
When are you allowed to use the horn ?
During the day:
Inside and outside built-up areas: to warn others and prevent an accident.
Outside built-up areas: to warn a driver you want to overtake.
Between sunset and sunrise:
Only in case of imminent danger.
In other situations, instead of the horn, you must use the lights: flashing alternately with high and low beam.

q:
You are driving on a one-way road and you want to turn left.
Where should you position yourself correctly ?

A. On the right side of the roadway.
B. In the middle of the roadway.
C. On the left side of the roadway.
e:
LESSON 21
When you want to turn left, you must position yourself as far to the left as possible on the roadway.

q:
You are approaching this intersection with your car.

A. You are required to turn left.
B. You may turn left or right.
e:
LESSON 24
The lower blue sign indicates that you may turn either left or right.

q:
What is the maximum permitted speed within a built-up area in Flanders ?

A. Maximum 30 km/h.
B. Maximum 50 km/h.
e:
SPECIAL PLACESIn Flanders and Wallonia: maximum 50 km/h.
In the Brussels Capital Region: maximum 30 km/h.

q:
What are you allowed to do under this bridge ?

A. Stop and park on the roadway.
B. Stop and park on the shoulder.
C. Neither stop nor park.
e:
LESSON 26
Under a bridge, you may not stop (wait) or park on the roadway, but you may on the shoulder if there is one.
Before this bridge, however, a sign prohibits stopping and parking on this side, both on the roadway and on the shoulder.

q:
You are approaching this intersection and you want to turn right.

A. You have priority over drivers coming from the left.
B. You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.
e:
LESSON 19
This is not a roundabout. There are no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the priority to the right applies.

q:
You are approaching this intersection and you want to turn right.

A. You have priority over drivers coming from the left.
B. You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.
e:
LESSON 19
This is not a roundabout. There are no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the priority to the right applies.

q:
Are you allowed to let someone get in or out at a bus stop ?

A. No, that's forbidden.
B. Yes, that's allowed.
e:
LESSON 22
At a bus stop, you may drive and stop briefly.
You are allowed to let someone get in or out at a bus stop.
Parking there for a bus is forbidden.

q:
You are approaching this intersection, and you want to turn right.

A. You have priority over drivers coming from the left.
B. You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.
e:
LESSON 19
This is a roundabout.
You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.

q:
Where must you leave at least 1.5 meters of lateral space when overtaking a cyclist ?

A. Inside built-up areas.
B. Outside built-up areas.
C. Always.
e:
LESSON 15
When overtaking outside built-up areas, a driver must leave a lateral distance of at least 1.5 meters between their vehicle and a pedestrian, cyclist, or two-wheeled moped.
Inside built-up areas, the required distance is 1 meter.

q:
On a bus lane, it is forbidden to ______

A. Drive and park.
B. Drive, being stationary and park.
e:
LESSON 22
A bus lane is not a part of the roadway. Therefore, it is forbidden to drive on it, being stationary on it, or to park on it. You may only use it a few meters before an intersection to turn left or right.

q:
Is this car allowed to move to the right lane ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON
The solid white line is on his side. He is not allowed to cross it.
After overtaking, however, a car may cross the solid line to return to the right lane.

q:
What is not allowed before and after this sign ?

A. Only parking on the roadway.
B. Only being stationary and parking on the roadway.
C. Being stationary and parking on the roadway and the verge.
e:
LESSON 26
This round sign with two diagonal stripes means that, on the side where it is placed, there is a prohibition of being stationary and parking on both the roadway and the verge. If numbers appear inside the sign, the rule applies only to the roadway.

q:
Fill in a number.
Beyond which sign are you not allowed to drive a car ?
e:
LESSON 23
Sign 3: This prohibition sign means that drivers of motor vehicles with more than two wheels and motorcycles with a sidecar are not allowed to drive past the sign. In the opposite direction, they are allowed.
Sign 1: End of motorway.
Sign 2: End of expressway.
Sign 4: Dead-end street.

q:
Friday afternoon. You have passed the theory exam.
The town hall is already closed to get a driving licence.
Are you allowed to drive a car already ?
e:
LESSON 1
The certificate showing that you passed is not a valid provisional driving licence. With it, you are definitely not allowed to drive.

q:
You are entering an intersection. Suddenly, a police officer raises his arm.
What do you do ?

A. You stop.
B. You stop and drive backwards.
C. You leave the intersection.
e:
LESSON 17
When a police officer raises his arm, it means that all vehicles must stop.
Vehicles already in the intersection must leave it as quickly as possible, continuing in the direction they intended to go.

q:
Which traffic sign will you see when you want to enter the motorway via the acceleration lane ?

A. Sign 1.
B. Sign 2.
C. Sign 3.
e:
LESSON 19
When entering the motorway, you must give way (and stop if necessary) to drivers already driving on the motorway.
You do not have to drive until the very end of the acceleration lane. You may merge as soon as it is safe.
When joining the motorway, no zip-merge is applied.

q:
Fill in a number.
Which traffic sign means: end of expressway ?
e:
LESSON 23
Sign 1: End of motorway.
Sign 2: End of expressway.
Sign 3: This prohibition sign means that drivers of motor vehicles with more than two wheels and motorcycles with a sidecar are not allowed to drive past the sign. In the opposite direction, they are allowed.
Sign 4: Dead-end street.

q:
Your car starts to skid.
In which direction should you look ?

A. Towards the danger.
B. Towards the direction you intended to go.
e:
LESSON 31
Although braking is probably your first instinct, you should avoid braking too hard. This can cause the wheels to lock and reduce traction.
What should you do instead ?
Look in the direction you want to go. Unconsciously, you will steer towards where you are looking. You can imagine what happens if you keep looking at the danger.
Steer in the opposite direction (counter-steer).
Press the clutch and release the accelerator.

q:
You are driving in the inner lane of a two-lane roundabout. What must you do to exit ?

A. Stop and wait until the cars in the outer lane have passed.
B. Exit directly, you have priority over the cars in the outer lane.
C. Keep circulating until the outer lane is free so you can exit.
e:
LESSON 19
To exit a two-lane roundabout from the inner lane, you must first change lanes to the outer lane, using your right indicator. You must give way to vehicles already driving in the outer lane. If you cannot do this in time, it is safer to make another loop around the roundabout rather than blocking traffic or creating a dangerous situation.

q:
A priority road outside built-up areas.
On which shoulder are you allowed to park ?

A. Only on the level shoulder.
B. Only on the raised shoulder.
C. On any shoulder.
e:
LESSON 26
Outside built-up areas, you may park on any shoulder along a priority road, unless prohibited by traffic signs or local police. Make sure not to obstruct other traffic. Also, you may not stop or park within 5 meters of an intersection and within 20 meters of a traffic light.

q:
A priority road within a built-up area.
Where are you allowed to park on the roadway ?

A. Only within a built-up area.
B. Only outside a built-up area.
C. Both within and outside a built-up area.
e:
LESSON 26
You are not allowed to park (but you may stop briefly) on a priority road outside a built-up area.
Inside a built-up area, parking is allowed, except:
within 5 meters of an intersection.
within 20 meters of traffic lights.

q:
How should you react if you approach a horse with a rider and the horse rears up in fear ?

A. You keep driving.
B. You slow down.
C. You stop.
e:
LESSON 1
If a horse on the road gets scared by a car and rears up, the driver must stop the vehicle and avoid any sudden movements, so that the rider can calm the horse and regain control of the situation before it escalates.

q:
There is a fire in a tunnel.
Are you allowed to turn around ?

A. Yes.
B. Yes, only if there are two lanes in your direction.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 29
In case of fire, park the car on the right side of the roadway. Leave the keys in the ignition and exit the tunnel through the emergency exit.

q:
Which sign do you see before the sign “end of priority road”?

A. Sign 1.
B. Sign 2.
C. Sign 3.
e:
LESSON 19
Sign 1 = priority at the next intersection.
Sign 2 = priority road.
Sign 3 = one-way street.

q:
The electric car that was driving in front of you in the tunnel has caught fire.
What do you do ?

A. You get out to see if you can help.
B. You drive backwards, fearing the car might explode.
C. You park your car and leave the tunnel through the emergency exit.
e:
LESSON 29
In case of fire in a tunnel, park the car on the right-hand lane. Leave the keys in the ignition and exit the tunnel through the emergency exit.

q:
The ladder extends 1 meter in front of the car body.
Is the driver allowed to drive like this ?

A. Yes, because it is a maximum of 1 meter.
B. Yes, if he signals the protruding load.
C. No.
e:
LESSON 10
A load may never extend beyond the front of the car body. At the rear, it may extend a maximum of 1 meter.
If you need to transport a load that is longer and indivisible or cannot be collapsed or folded, it may extend up to 3 meters behind the car body, provided that you attach this warning panel to the rear of the load.

q:
Which vehicles are you not allowed to overtake with your car after this sign ?

A. Only a cyclist.
B. Only a cyclist and a class A moped.
C. A cyclist, a class A moped and a motorcycle.
e:
LESSON 3
This sign marks the beginning of a bicycle zone.
In a bicycle zone, motor vehicles (including mopeds) are not allowed to overtake cyclists, speed pedelecs and bicycles up to 1 m wide.
Other vehicles may be overtaken if they are driving too slowly.
The maximum permitted speed in a bicycle zone is 30 km/h.

q:
Which vehicles are you NOT allowed to overtake with your car past this sign ?

A. Only a cyclist.
B. Only a cyclist and a step.
C. A cyclist, a step and a speed pedelec.
e:
LESSON 3
This sign marks the beginning of a bicycle zone.
In a bicycle zone, motor vehicles (including mopeds) are not allowed to overtake cyclists, speed pedelecs and bicycles up to 1 m wide.
Other vehicles may be overtaken if they are driving too slowly.
The maximum permitted speed in a bicycle zone is 30 km/h.

q:
When are you allowed to drive with snow chains on your tires ?

A. From November 1st until March 31st.
B. When there is snow or ice on the road.
e:
LESSON 31
In Belgium, snow chains may only be used when there is snow or ice on the road. Vehicles equipped with chains are not subject to any special speed limit, but drivers must always adapt their speed to the road conditions.
For safety reasons, it is preferable to place snow chains on all four wheels. If only two are used, they must be fitted on the driving wheels.

q: Are towing services allowed to drive on the hard shoulder while working ?
e:
LESSON 4
Police, emergency services and towing services (while working) may drive on the hard shoulder, the peak-hour lane and the emergency corridor.

q:
You are driving your car in a new municipality in Flanders.
What is the maximum speed you may drive past this sign on a normal road ?

A. 50 km/h.
B. 70 km/h.
C. 90 km/h.
e: SPECIAL PLACESThe yellow sign with a red border only indicates the administrative start of a municipality. It does NOT indicate the start of a built-up area and has no other meaning.

q:
There are no traffic signs.
Are these cars parked correctly ?
e: WAITING AND PARKINGThe cars are parked on the shoulder. But there is no 1.5 meter of free space left for the pedestrian. These cars must be parked on the roadway.

q:
The car is parked on the roadway, 30 cm from the shoulder.
Is it correctly parked ?
e: WAITING AND PARKINGThe shoulder is several meters wide. The car must be parked on the shoulder. More than 1.5 meters of free space remains for pedestrians.

q: Is the grey car in the correct lane to turn right ?
e:
LESSON 21
The car must be positioned at least in the right lane and was even allowed to use the last meters of the bus lane.

q:
The blue car is entering the intersection.
Is the driver allowed to do that ?

A. Yes, because he has priority from the right.
B. No, because the red car is going straight ahead.
e:
LESSON 20
At intersections where: there is no authorized officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority, the rule of priority to the right applies. This means that every driver (of a car, motorcycle, two-wheeled moped, or bicycle) must yield to a driver coming from the right, except when driving on a roundabout or when the driver coming from the right is coming from a prohibited direction.

q:
The blue car is entering the intersection.
Is the driver allowed to do that ?
e:
LESSON 20
At intersections where: there is no authorized officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority, the rule of priority to the right applies. This means that every driver (of a car, motorcycle, two-wheeled moped, or bicycle) must yield to a driver coming from the right, except when driving on a roundabout or when the driver coming from the right is coming from a prohibited direction.

q:
The blue car is entering the intersection.
Is the driver allowed to do that ?

A. Yes, because he is going straight ahead.
B. Yes, because he has priority from the right.
e:
LESSON 20
At intersections where: there is no authorized officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority, the rule of priority to the right applies. This means that every driver (of a car, motorcycle, two-wheeled moped, or bicycle) must yield to a driver coming from the right, except when driving on a roundabout or when the driver coming from the right is coming from a prohibited direction.

q:
You want to leave the motorway.
Where should you brake ?

A. Maximum 150 meters before the exit.
B. Maximum 50 meters before the exit.
C. Only once you are on the exit lane.
e:
LESSON 4
Of course, there is no rule that obliges you to still drive 120 km/h just before the exit. You may already drive a bit slower before reaching the exit. But actual braking, meaning pressing the brake pedal, should only be done once you are on the exit lane.

q:
A roadway without markings.
Is the black car allowed to overtake the grey one on the left ?
e:
LESSON 15
If the roadway is wide enough to keep a safe lateral distance and the maneuver can be done safely, it is allowed to overtake another vehicle on the left on this roadway (unless a traffic sign prohibits it).

q:
A roadway divided into traffic lanes.
May the black car overtake the grey one on the left ?
e:
LESSON 2
If a roadway is divided into lanes by a broken white line, you may cross that line to overtake a vehicle on the left, provided it is safe to do so and no traffic sign prohibits overtaking.

q:
A roadway divided into traffic lanes.
May the black car overtake the grey one on the left ?
e:
LESSON 2
You may not cross a continuous white line between lanes to overtake another vehicle.

q: May a user of a motorized personal mobility device be overtaken by motor vehicles in a bicycle zone ?
e:
LESSON 3
Users of motorized personal mobility devices are treated the same as cyclists.
In a bicycle zone, cyclists may not be overtaken by motor vehicles. This overtaking ban also applies to motorcycles and mopeds of class A and B. The speed pedelec, however, is considered a bicycle and may overtake other cyclists.
On the other hand, cyclists may overtake each other and other road users. Overtaking must always be done on the left. A cyclist may also pass stationary vehicles on the right.
Priority vehicles (police, fire brigade, ambulance with siren and flashing light) are still allowed to overtake cyclists. If a priority vehicle is approaching, clear the roadway.

q:
You are driving at 105 km/h on an ordinary road in Flanders.
What is the consequence ?

A. A fine.
B. An immediate withdrawal of your driving licence.
C. You will have to appear in court.
e:
LESSON 12
The maximum permitted speed on an ordinary road in Flanders is 70 km/h. You are therefore driving 35 km/h too fast.
1. Immediate temporary withdrawal of the driving licence.
You risk an immediate withdrawal of your licence as soon as you exceed the speed limit by more than 30 km/h on motorways, expressways, and ordinary roads.
2. Disqualification from the right to drive a motor vehicle (judge).
-You risk disqualification as soon as you exceed the speed limit by more than 40 km/h on those same roads.

q:
You are approaching this bridge.
If an oncoming vehicle approaches, who has the right of way ?

A. You.
B. The oncoming vehicle.
e:
LESSON 14
There is a road narrowing. The blue priority sign means that you have the right of way.

q:
You are approaching this bridge and see this traffic sign.
What does it mean ?

A. Reduction of lanes.
B. Road narrowing.
e:
LESSON 14
This warning sign means road narrowing.
The sign that indicates a reduction of lanes is a blue information sign.

q:
You are driving at 75 km/h within a built-up area in Flanders.
What are the consequences ?

A. A fine.
B. An immediate withdrawal of your driving licence.
C. You will have to appear in court.
e:
LESSON 12
1. If you drive in a built-up area, a 30-zone, or a residential area at more than 20 km/h above the speed limit, you risk an immediate withdrawal of your driving licence. This withdrawal is carried out by the police, because it is considered a serious offence. For any serious offence, your licence can be taken away on the spot.
2. In a built-up area, a 30-zone, or a residential area, if you exceed the speed limit by more than 30 km/h, you risk a driving ban pronounced by the judge in court. Depending on the ruling, you may be prohibited from driving any motor vehicle (even those not requiring a licence) for a period ranging from at least 8 days up to 5 years. For novice drivers (< 2 years with a full category B licence), the rules are even stricter.

q:
At the top right, a sign warns drivers that the car's lights must be on.
But which lights ?

A. The dipped headlights.
B. The parking lights.
C. The fog lights.
e:
LESSON 11
When the dipped headlights (or the main beams) are on, the two parking lights at the front and the two red lights at the rear are also lit.
The dipped headlights must be on:
During the day:
in rain, when visibility is less than 200 meters;
in fog, when visibility is less than 200 meters;
in snowfall, when visibility is less than 200 meters;
or in other conditions (e.g. smoke from a fire) when visibility is less than 200 meters, such as in this tunnel.

q:
May the driver of the car overtake the cyclist on the left at this intersection ?

A. No, because it is an intersection with right-of-way from the right.
B. Yes, if he leaves 1.5 meters of lateral space.
e:
LESSON 16
At an intersection where right-of-way from the right applies, a cyclist may be overtaken on the left.
When overtaking a cyclist (or moped) on the left, the driver must leave:
1 meter of lateral distance in built-up areas.
1.5 meters outside built-up areas.

q:
The saliva test is positive.
How many hours of temporary driving ban do you immediately receive ?

A. 6 hours.
B. 12 hours.
C. 24 hours.
e:
LESSON 28
During a saliva test, a cotton swab is used to scrape saliva from the mouth to determine the presence of drugs.
If the result exceeds the legal limit: you must immediately hand over your driving licence for 12 hours. An immediate withdrawal of the licence is also possible. After 12 hours, a new saliva test follows.
Offenders also risk heavy fines and a driving ban of up to 5 years.
Refusing the saliva test = immediate 12-hour driving ban.
The saliva test may only be carried out if the police suspect drug use.

q:
You drive past the first sign.
Which sign will you most likely see next ?

A. Sign 1.
B. Sign 2.
C. Sign 3.
e:
LESSON 24
The first sign means: End of priority road.
So at the next intersection, you will have to yield the right of way.
Sign 1: Mandatory direction.
Sign 2: One-way street.
Sign 3: Right-of-way from the right

q:
After drinking a lot of alcohol, what actually lowers your blood alcohol level ?

A. Taking medication prescribed by my pharmacist.
B. Drinking coffee.
C. Waiting, only time reduces your blood alcohol level.
e:
LESSON 28
There are no medicines or tricks to lower your blood alcohol level. The only solution is to wait until your body has processed the alcohol and you are sober again.

q:
What should you do in a long tunnel to stay safe ?

A. Pay close attention to where the emergency exits are.
B. Switch on your dipped headlights.
C. Listen carefully to traffic information.
e:
LESSON 29
If a tunnel is longer than 500 meters, it is indicated by this road sign.
Inside a tunnel, it is usually darker than outside on the road. That's why you should remove your sunglasses and switch on your dipped headlights well before entering.
In a tunnel, it is forbidden to: park or stop, make a U-turn, or drive backwards.

q:
An intersection without traffic signs. The priority-to-the-right rule applies.
The truck is moving slowly onto the intersection, ready to turn left.
May the grey car overtake it on the right at the intersection ?
e:
LESSON 16
What the traffic rules say:
Normally, overtaking is done on the left.
Exception: overtaking is allowed on the right when the driver to be overtaken has signaled the intention to turn left and has moved to the left side to perform this maneuver.
Overtaking on the left at intersections where the priority-to-the-right rule applies is prohibited, except in this specific case.

q:
The driver of the grey car is driving at this intersection behind the truck, which is moving slowly.
Is the grey car allowed to overtake the truck on the left ?
e:
LESSON 16
There are no traffic signs at this intersection. Therefore, the rule of priority to the right applies.
Overtaking on the left is prohibited at this intersection. The only exception: a cyclist may be overtaken.

q:
What is the maximum allowed speed in Flanders until the end of 2026 past this sign ?

A. 30 km/h.
B. 20 km/h.
C. Walking pace.
e: SPECIAL PLACESThe sign indicates the beginning of a residential zone. According to the new highway code, which will (likely) come into effect in October 2026, the maximum speed in a residential zone in Flanders will then be reduced to walking pace.

q:
Is this car allowed to park at that spot in this residential area ?

A. No, it must park on the shoulder.
B. No.
C. Yes, because it is parked close to the edge of the roadway.
e: SPECIAL PLACESIn a residential area, cars may only park in places specifically designated for parking. They may be parked on either the left or right side of the roadway, depending on the direction of traffic.

q:
Is this car allowed to park at that spot in this residential area ?

A. No, it must park on the shoulder.
B. No.
C. Yes, because in a residential area, you are allowed to park on the left or right side of the roadway.
e: In a residential area, cars may only park in places specifically designated for parking. They may be parked on either the left or right side of the roadway, depending on the direction of traffic.

q:
When you see this traffic sign, you know ...

A. ... that the tunnel is 200 meters long.
B. ... that the tunnel is 500 meters long.
e:
LESSON 29
The upper sign indicates that the tunnel is at least 500 meters long.
The exact length can be shown on the upper sign.
The additional sign indicates that the tunnel starts in 200 meters.

q:
After which sign do you know that the tunnel has a length of 700 meters ?

A. After both signs.
B. After the first sign.
C. After the second sign.
e:
LESSON 29
The first sign indicates that a tunnel of 500 meters starts 700 meters further.
The exact length of the tunnel can be shown on the sign itself. In this case, 700 meters.

q:
When you see this road sign, you know ______

A. ______ that the tunnel is 700 meters long.
B. ______ that there is a tunnel 700 meters ahead.
e:
LESSON 29
The exact length of a tunnel can be indicated on the sign. In this case, 700 meters.

q:
An accident without injuries at an intersection within a built-up area.
You have already placed a warning triangle.
What do you do next ?

A. You try to park the cars in a safe place.
B. You notify the police.
C. You leave the cars where they are, and fill in the European accident report.
e:
LESSON 29
In the case of a minor accident without injuries, you should try to clear the intersection.
If that is truly impossible and the cars block the intersection, then you notify the police.

q:
May a smartphone be used as a GPS in the car ?

A. No, that is forbidden.
B. Yes, always.
C. Yes, if it is placed in a fixed holder.
e:
LESSON 31
Using a smartphone as a GPS is allowed, as long as the device is placed in a fixed holder.
Of course, you may only hold the smartphone in your hand when you are stopped or parked.

q:
Traffic is moving very slowly.
Is this lady allowed to quickly call her employer, to say that she will arrive a bit later ?
e:
LESSON 31
Electronic devices such as a phone, tablet (______) distract the driver.
That is why drivers are not allowed to use, hold or manipulate a mobile electronic device with a screen while driving, unless the device is placed in a proper holder attached to the vehicle.
Electronic devices may be used when the car is standing still or parked. But stopping at a traffic light or in a traffic jam is not considered as ‘standing still'

q:
Where are you not allowed to overtake a cyclist on the left ?

A. In a dangerous bend with very poor visibility.
B. At an intersection with priority of the right.
C. On a priority road.
e:
LESSON 16
In or before a dangerous bend, it is forbidden to overtake on the left a team (e.g., horse and cart), a vehicle with more than two wheels, or a two-wheeled motor vehicle.
But when visibility is very poor, you are also not allowed to overtake a cyclist.

q:
An intersection without traffic signs.
The white car wants to turn left.
The grey car wants to turn right.
Who has the right of way ?

A. The white car.
B. The grey car.
C. Whoever turns first automatically has the right of way.
e:
LESSON 21
The grey car is turning right and taking the shorter turn. It has the right of way.

q:
An intersection without traffic signs.
The white car wants to go straight ahead.
The grey car wants to turn left.
Who has priority ?

A. The white car.
B. The grey car.
e:
LESSON 21
Traffic going straight has priority over traffic that is turning.

q:
An intersection without traffic signs.
The driver of the white car stops briefly at the intersection and then wants to drive straight ahead. But the grey car suddenly turns left.

A. That is allowed, because the grey car comes from the right.
B. That is allowed, because the white car stopped.
C. That is not allowed, because the white car goes straight on.
e:
LESSON 21
Traffic going straight has priority over turning traffic.
Even if the driver of the white car stops briefly, he keeps his priority.

q:
The grey car quickly reversed at this intersection because the white car was approaching at high speed.
But who has the right of way here ?

A. The white car, because it goes straight ahead.
B. The grey car, because it comes from the right.
e:
LESSON 20
At an intersection where no authorised person, traffic lights or road signs regulate priority, the priority to the right applies.
The grey car comes from the right and therefore has priority. The white car should have stopped.

q:
The driver of this car is waiting for her friend in this residential area.
Is the car parked correctly ?

A. Yes, because the car is in front of the traffic sign.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 26
In a residential area, you may only park in the designated parking spaces provided for that purpose.

q:
The driver of this car is waiting for her friend within a built-up area.
Is the car parked correctly ?

A. Yes, because the car is in front of the traffic sign.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 26
A broken white line divides the roadway into lanes.
This means that parking on the roadway is not allowed. You may stop only briefly to let someone get in or out.
Waiting for someone counts as parking.

q:
The driver of this car is waiting for her friend within a built-up area.
Is the car parked correctly ?

A. Yes, because the car is in front of the traffic sign.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 26
In that place, this car is allowed to park or stand still on the roadway.

q:
The driver of the car has stopped to let the child get in.
Is that allowed at this place ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 26
There is a broken white line between the traffic lanes. That means parking is not allowed there.
But stopping to let someone get in is allowed.

q:
Is this car correctly parked in this 30-zone ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e: WAITING AND PARKINGVehicles must be parked on the right side of the roadway, in the direction of travel.

q:
You have stopped at the stop line.
To whom must you give way ?

A. To all road users.
B. To drivers on the crossing road.
e:
LESSON 19
A STOP means you must come to a complete stop at the stop line and yield to drivers who are on the public road you want to enter.
If there is no stop line on the road surface, you must stop at the sign.
If there are no drivers on the crossing road, you still have to make a full stop before entering the intersection.

q:
The driver of this car wants to turn right at this intersection.
Is he in the correct lane position ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 21
This driver must position himself as far to the right as possible on the road when he wants to turn right.

q:
The driver of this car saw no other road users and carefully entered the intersection without stopping.
Was he allowed to do that ?

A. Yes, because there is no stop line on the road.
B. Yes, because he is turning right.
C. No, he must stop first.
e:
LESSON 19
A STOP means you must come to a complete stop at the stop line and yield to drivers on the public road you want to enter.
If there is no stop line on the pavement, you must stop at the traffic sign.
Even if there are no drivers on the crossing road, you must still come to a complete stop before entering the intersection.

q:
The driver of this car saw no other road users and carefully entered the intersection without stopping.
Was he allowed to do that ?

A. Yes, because there is no stop line on the road.
B. No, he must stop first.
e:
LESSON 19
A STOP means you must come to a complete stop at the stop line and yield to drivers on the public road you want to enter.
If there is no stop line on the pavement, you must stop at the traffic sign.
Even if there are no drivers on the crossing road, you must still come to a complete stop before entering the intersection.

q:
A driver has to make a long trip abroad.
How often should he ideally take a break ?

A. Every half hour.
B. Every hour.
C. Every two hours.
e: During a long car journey, it is recommended to take a short break of at least 15 minutes about every two hours to prevent fatigue and stay alert. Make sure to get out of the car, stretch your legs, take deep breaths, and stay hydrated with water or light snacks.

q:
A driver has to make a long trip abroad.
How often should he ideally take a break ?

A. Every half hour.
B. Every hour.
C. Every two hours.
e:
LESSON 13
During a long car journey, it is recommended to take a short break of at least 15 minutes about every two hours to prevent fatigue and stay alert. Make sure to get out of the car, stretch your legs, take deep breaths, and stay hydrated with water or light snacks.

q:
A one-way street in a built-up area.
Is this car parked correctly ?

A. Yes, it may be parked on the left or right side of the carriageway.
B. No, it must be parked on the right side of the carriageway.
e: WAITING AND PARKINGOn a one-way street, a vehicle may be parked on either the left or the right side of the carriageway.

q:
Is this car parked correctly ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 27
The car is parked before the blue sign with the letter P.
At that point, the roadway is still divided into lanes with a broken line.
Parking is only allowed after the sign.

q:
What is the maximum allowed speed for this car on this road in Wallonia ?

A. 70 km/h.
B. 90 km/h.
C. 120 km/h.
e:
LESSON 12
There are 2 x 2 lanes, separated by a central reservation.
The maximum allowed speed in all regions, outside built-up areas, is 120 km/h.

q:
What is the maximum permitted speed for the motorcycle on this N-road in Flanders ?

A. 70 km/h.
B. 90 km/h.
C. 120 km/h.
e:
LESSON 12
An N-road is considered an ordinary road.
In Flanders and in the Brussels Region, the maximum permitted speed on an ordinary road is 70 km/h.
In Wallonia, it is 90 km/h.

q:
How old must you be to take the theoretical exam for a category B driving licence ?

A. 17 years old.
B. 17 years and 9 months.
C. 18 years old.
e:
DRIVING LICENCE
As soon as you are 17 years old, you may take the theory exam in an official exam centre. To pass, you need to score at least 41 out of 50 points.

q:
From what age can you start learning to drive a car in Belgium ?

A. 17 years.
B. 17 years and 9 months.
C. 18 years.
e:
DRIVING LICENCE - GENERAL
From the age of 17, and after passing the theory test, you may start learning to drive a car with a driving school or with an accompanying instructor.

q:
From what age can you take the practical driving test for licence B in Belgium ?

A. 17 years.
B. 17 years and 9 months.
C. 18 years.
e:
DRIVING LICENCE - GENERAL
As soon as you are 18 years old, you can take the practical driving test for licence B in an examination centre, provided that your training period meets the legal requirements.

q:
Just before entering this tunnel, it suddenly starts to rain heavily.
Which lights do you use when driving inside the tunnel ?

A. The dipped headlights.
B. The dipped headlights and the rear fog light.
C. The dipped headlights, the rear fog light, and the front fog lights.
e:
LESSON 11
Inside the tunnel, it is quite dark and visibility is less than 200 meters. Therefore, you must drive with your dipped headlights on.
Inside the tunnel it does not rain, so the fog lights are not used.

q:
On the way, it rained heavily. Finally, this driver reaches the tunnel.
With which lights does he continue his ride in the tunnel ?

A. The dipped headlights.
B. The dipped headlights and the rear fog light.
C. The dipped headlights, the rear fog light, and the front fog lights.
e:
LESSON 11
Inside the tunnel, it is quite dark and visibility is less than 200 meters. Therefore, you must drive with your dipped headlights on.
Inside the tunnel it does not rain, so the fog lights are not used.

q:
What is the maximum permitted speed for the motorcycle on this ordinary road in Wallonia ?

A. 50 km/h.
B. 70 km/h.
C. 90 km/h.
e:
LESSON 2
On an ordinary road in Wallonia, the maximum permitted speed is 90 km/h.
But there is a traffic sign indicating that the maximum permitted speed is 70 km/h.

q:
The driver of this car has stopped to answer the phone.
Is he allowed to do that here ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 26
Stopping to answer the phone is considered parking.
On a road with a broken white line between the lanes, parking is prohibited.
Only a brief stop to let someone get in or out is allowed.

q:
The driver of this car has stopped to answer the phone.
Is he allowed to do that here ?

A. Yes.
B. No.
e:
LESSON 26
Stopping to answer the phone is considered parking.
On a road without broken or solid white lines between the lanes, parking and stopping are allowed.

q:
You have a permit to drive your car in a play street.
A child wants to cross the road at a place without a pedestrian crossing.
Who has the right of way ?

A. The child.
B. The car.
e:
SPECIAL PLACESIn a play street, children may use the entire roadway.
Anyone allowed to drive there must proceed at walking speed.

q:
